rComments: Professor Calof requires enormous time investment and volumes of reading tests for 1.5 credit course in a professional cohort. I had missed the essence of the course since I was lost in doing so much work.

This prof and this class is probably one of the most meaningful things for your time at Telfer. The difficulty might be a little high for average students, but I really learn a lot from this prof’s splendid explanation on the concepts, maybe due to the fact that I am a little smarter. Choose him plz
Class is not difficult in nature, but the teaching he does, doesn't relate back to the assignments which makes them more difficult and frustrating. Class is pretty useless.
Interesting and engaging teaching style. Very knowledgeable in his field. Always happy to answer questions. Does ramble on some tangents and stories, but never keeps class late so it isn't too bad.
Avoid. Loves himself too much. He only talks about himself and makes everyone else feel stupid. Not a good person. Regretted every moment.

Not a difficult course. You need to tolerate the professor's dialogue on himself and how he is the greatest thing to have walked on earth. People who talk this much about themselves are clearly making up for a lack in another department. I would never use this man for anything related to CI. What a waste of time.

Class with Calof was by far the class in which I learned the most life skills. Don't be fooled by the class title, you will learn so much more than just Competitive Intelligence. We even had a 3-hour participative workshop with a guest on developing people-skills like reading people's body language. So much class participation the whole semester

Do not take this class. He is awful and does not know how to be a professor. He doesn't teach, he just talks about his experiences. He is not at all specific on how to write assignments, is condescending when grading, and even more condescending when you ask for help. He is an AWFUL PROFESSOR. You're better off googling "competitive intelligence".
Very interesting to listen to but very condescending during feedback sessions and very unclear about assignment structure and gives vague answers when asked. Unfairly hard marker in my opinion.

Jonathan Calof is an interesting professor. I highly recommend to students(especially in undergrad) who aren't that serious and aren't focusing HEAVILY on their personal/career development. He's EXTREMELY intelligent and EXPERIENCED, it can be very overwhelming if YOU don't have a lot of experience or are trying to get an "easy A". Smartest Prof!

This prof is clearly very intelligent and has lots of life experience. Having said that, he also belittles his students when they have questions about assignment instructions. He has an assignment called the "Calof Profile" which consists of collecting intelligence on HIMSELF. It is absolutely ridiculous. I would not recommend you take him.
teacherRatingTags: ['Lots of homework', 'Get ready to read', 'Participation matters']

rComments: Amazing lecturer, interesting, not boring. Participation 30%, the 70% is for intopia, small group memo, peer evaluation. So PARTICIPATE, then easy A! There is no midterm, no final. You only need to participate, do 2 small group memo, and Intopia. As a person who find all telfer classes are boring, I would say this one is exception. Great prof!
His criteria for grading is not clear. Assignment is very confusing and basically the blackboard of the class is always sloppy...
teacherRatingTags: ['Beware of pop quizzes', 'Tough grader', 'Get ready to read']

rComments: The case-based teaching method was an excellent way to apply the theory. Full of himself.
Calof is an AMAZING Prof. Favourite teacher in Telfer, hands down. Always willing to help and very educated.

His English was impeccable, too good and fast for unskilled foreign students. Being a ?craftsman?, he taught us by movement, not in a theoretical manner. He coached us in Strategy using his kinesthetic intelligence to coagulate and lead adverse teams into relevant arguments. He moved around the class that no one would ignore the combat. This focuse

No. 1 Prof. at taking feedback from a challenger Unmatched in stimulating class participation Guiding the lotus of reason above the mud of misunderstanding with acid discernment Father of Many in the field of Business Strategy Unforgettable, like a splinter in our mind Building bridges of gratefulness that withstand time
His course is difficult in a rewarding way.

Wow. I'm entirely certain that most of these poor reviews were written by undergrads who spent most of their classes on Facebook.  Calof is friendly, intelligent, interesting and knowledgeable. I learned more from him than any other professor. In fact he provided me more help than my thesis advisor did.  I would go back to school just for the o

Course was one of the less interesting and valuable ones I've taken. The prof. was not interested in us or our learning. He is very focused -- on himself and his consulting, and speaks a lot about them both. I wish he spent half that time on us.
Wow! We're trying to talk to this prof. and he won't address any of our concerns. Seemed like a nice guy at first but I guess I judged too soon!!!!!!
Not one of the school's brightest professors, but a good presenter nonetheless.  Although you won't get much else out of the course, the classes provide good entertainment value.
Dynamic and very interesting Professor full of experiences
great analitical models presented, makes you think differently.

Amazing prof. You can stay hours just listening to him without any break. But he expects so much from students the pressure is unbearable. First time I saw a prof giving Fs on a master's level course!
Great prof! Dynamic, knows his stuff, travels around the world as a consultant which makes his class all the more interesting.
One of the best! Calof is briliant and really knows how to involve students in thinking properly about stategy issues.
Very good prof. Show off, but he knows his stuff. If you like interactive courses this is great, but if you expect a guy who would stand up and teach while you listen, this is NOT the course for you
Great prof.  The best I've had so far.  Makes the class interesting, stimulating, and entertaining.  I learnt more in his class than in any other so far.
He's just all over the place when teaching.
Loved the subject, great prof.

I'm not sure which of the official languages he taught our class in but it was not one my classmates or I could understand. What was he speaking about? What about those assignments? Whoa. Scary. Glad I'm over it. Too bad I didn't learn anything of
Real funny. Always goofing around...  He's a GREAT prof. (Same teaching style as Prof Guolla). Out of my 4 years in university, I think he's my favorite!
not a bad course overall
He is incredibly scattered, he confuses you more than he helps you.
Knows his stuff - great communicator
Awesome prof....he knows his stuff
